metadata.Title: CVE-2021-3507 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - low
metadata.Description:
A heap buffer overflow was found in the floppy disk emulator of QEMU up to6.0.0 (including). It could occur in fdctrl_transfer_handler() inhw/block/fdc.c while processing DMA read data transfers from the floppydrive to the guest system. A privileged guest user could use this flaw tocrash the QEMU process on the host resulting in DoS scenario, or potentialinformation leakage from the host memory.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-3507` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

qemu - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.40
qemu-block-extra - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.40
qemu-guest-agent - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.40
qemu-kvm - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.40
qemu-system - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.40
qemu-system-arm - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.40
qemu-system-common - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.40
qemu-system-mips - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.40
qemu-system-misc - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.40
qemu-system-ppc - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.40
qemu-system-s390x - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.40
qemu-system-sparc - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.40
qemu-system-x86 - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.40
qemu-user - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.40
qemu-user-binfmt - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.40
qemu-user-static - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.40
qemu-utils - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.40
No subscription required

criterions.comment: qemu package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.40').
